headline: Chicago Police Say Woman Killed Accidentally
summary: A Chicago police officer responding to a domestic disturbance call Saturday accidentally shot and killed a 55-year-old woman, who was among two people fatally wounded, police said late Saturday.

headline: Carpooling Makes a Comeback
summary: Carpooling is gaining popularity, and perhaps easing the congestion, in New York City with the help of for-hire apps.

headline: Floods Force Mass Evacuations in South America
summary: Widespread floods have forced nearly 140,000 people from their homes in the region where Paraguay, Argentina, Uruguay and Brazil border each other.

headline: Trucker Teams Drive to the Rescue
summary: Retailers and parcel carriers have been turning this season to teams—which keep trucks rolling for hundreds of miles over 20 hours a day—as a way to meet the demands of online shopping to deliver goods rapidly, and cheaply, across long distances.

headline: ISIS Leader Challenges U.S., Allies
summary: Islamic State leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi challenged the U.S. and its allies in a rare message, while telling his followers to persevere despite battlefields setbacks, according to a purported audio message released Saturday.

headline: Pope Francis’ Christmas Eve Mass Homily
summary: The Vatican’s official English translation of Pope Francis’ Christmas Eve Mass homily, which he delivered in Italian.

headline: Austrian Police Increase Security After Terror Warning
summary: Austrian police said Saturday they had strengthened security measures after receiving a warning from a “friendly” intelligence service about a possible terror attack in the days between Christmas and New Year’s.

headline: Evacuation of Militants From Damascus Is Suspended
summary: A United Nations-brokered deal to allow safe passage to hundreds of militants and their families, many affiliated with Islamic State, from the southern suburbs of the Syrian capital has been suspended.

headline: Kurdish Group Claims Responsibility for Turkey Blast
summary: A Kurdish militant group claimed responsibility for a blast at an Istanbul  airport that killed a worker, raising concerns about expansion of a conflict that has largely been isolated to southeastern Turkey.

headline: Texas Gears Up for Open-Carry Law
summary: Licensed firearms owners in Texas will soon be able to openly carry a handgun in most places, and businesses and other establishments are weighing whether to continue to bar the practice.

headline: Muslim Rebel Attacks in Philippines Kill 14
summary: Attacks by Muslim rebels against Christian communities in the Philippines’ volatile south left at least 14 people dead, a military spokeswoman said.

headline: Afghan Earthquake Injures at Least 12
summary: At least 12 people were injured in Afghanistan’s eastern province of Nangarhar after a 6.2-magnitude earthquake struck.

headline: Dozens Missing After Another Myanmar Landslide
summary: Dozens of people are missing and feared dead after a landslide struck a remote jade-mining region in northern Myanmar, the second such incident in a month, officials said.

headline: Citigroup’s New Office Plan: No Offices
summary: Citigroup is adopting an open-plan layout in its new headquarters tower in Manhattan where no one, not even CEO Michael Corbat, will have a door. Most employees won’t even get their own desks.

headline: Australian Wildfire Destroys More Than 100 Homes
summary: The blaze that tore through a stretch of coastline popular with tourists in southern Australia destroyed 116 houses and forced thousands to flee their homes, officials said.

headline: Activism’s Long Road From Corporate Raiding to Banner Year
summary: Activist investors have transformed themselves from derided corporate raiders to accepted voices in the corporate boardroom, helping produce a banner year.
